intro: Valeriana tunuyanense, commonly known as the Tunuyan valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in whorls around the stem. Valeriana tunuyanense is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its calming effects.
